p: The hepatitis C virus is an RNA virus with a single positive-stranded RNA genome. The virus belongs to the Flaviviridae family and has 50 μm in diameter. The HCV nucleocapsid is capsulated with two wrapping proteins (E1 and E2) and can encode 6 nonstructural proteins (nonstructural 3/4A (NS3/4A), NS5A, and NS5B) which are the targets of direct-acting antiviral drugs ( Puchades and Berenguer, 2018). NS3/4 protease is also a target protein for HCV ( Dinesh et al., 2020).
